html.h2: How to Use the | req Command
html.p: The | req command lets you make HTTP or HTTPS requests directly from Splunk searches. You can use it in the Search & Reporting app or any other search view.
html.pre: | req url="https://api.github.com" | req url="https://api.example.com/data" method=POST data="{\"foo\": \"bar\"}"

ul.li: method: HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
headers: JSON object of request headers
verify: true/false to enable or disable SSL verification
identity / realm: For stored Splunk credentials

html.p: Open the Search & Reporting app and run any of the examples above in the search bar.
Tip: You can combine | req with other commands to process API results directly in Splunk.
